definition: to have a snack/to have a bite

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement
to desensitize/to remove an allergic susceptibility
medicine to be taken after being mixed with water (or other liquid)
yellow face, emaciated body (idiom); malnourished and sickly in appearance
lit. drinking poison in the hope of quenching one's thirst (idiom)/fig. a supposed remedy that only makes matters worse
lit. to give medicine to a dead horse (idiom)/fig. to keep trying everything in a desperate situation

definition: When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
